page.title: 01Synopsis of area.
page.content: The block surveyed is a good example of erosion of the "green belt" by housing and industrial development. Housing developments on farmland include Pantmawr(1953),Coryton(1957) and the Castle View & Loughor Estates at Radyr.Industrial commercial developments include Amersham International(1980),Asda superstore (1984) & A.B.Electronics(1985).These are all built on the former Forest Farm while the Telecom building was built in the grounds of Coryton House formerly owned by the Cory family. During recent years the centre of Whitchurch has grown into the main shopping centre of the area.It appears to be thriving despite the presence of the ASDA superstore.The M4 motorway with its interchange at Coryton and the trunk road to Merthyr make the area very accessible to other regions.
